meanings.definition: A sudden burst of light or flame.
meanings.sent1: The glift of the fireworks lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent2: I saw a glift of lightning in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The glift from the candle startled the cat.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a glift in the darkness of the room.
meanings.sent5: The glift of the shooting star left a lasting impression on me.

meanings.definition: To shine brightly for a short period of time.
meanings.sent1: The sun will glift over the horizon at dawn.
meanings.sent2: The fireflies glifted in the garden at night.
meanings.sent3: The disco ball glifted and dazzled the dancers.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes glifted with excitement when she saw the surprise.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse will glift to guide ships safely to shore.

meanings.definition: A brief, intense sensation or feeling.
meanings.sent1: A glift of fear ran down his spine as he heard a noise.
meanings.sent2: She felt a glift of joy when she received good news.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected compliment gave her a glift of happiness.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a glift of warmth on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The memory brought a glift of nostalgia for the good old days.
